<!-- WARNING: this file was generated by Pulumi Docs Generator. -->
<!-- Do not edit by hand unless you're certain you know what you are doing! -->

Provides a customer gateway inside a VPC. These objects can be connected to VPN gateways via VPN connections, and allow you to establish tunnels between your network and the VPC.

<div><pulumi-examples>

```csharp
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using Pulumi;
using Aws = Pulumi.Aws;

return await Deployment.RunAsync(() => 
{
    var main = new Aws.Ec2.CustomerGateway("main", new()
    {
        BgpAsn = "65000",
        IpAddress = "172.83.124.10",
        Tags = 
        {
            { "Name", "main-customer-gateway" },
        },
        Type = "ipsec.1",
    });

});
```

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aws/sdk/v6/go/aws/ec2"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := ec2.NewCustomerGateway(ctx, "main", &ec2.CustomerGatewayArgs{
			BgpAsn:    pulumi.String("65000"),
			IpAddress: pulumi.String("172.83.124.10"),
			Tags: pulumi.StringMap{
				"Name": pulumi.String("main-customer-gateway"),
			},
			Type: pulumi.String("ipsec.1"),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```

### Inputs

The CustomerGateway resource accepts the following [input](/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs) properties:

            title="Required">
        <span id="bgpasn_csharp">

</span>

    </dt>
    <dd><p>The gateway's Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Autonomous System Number (ASN).</p>

            title="Required">
        <span id="type_csharp">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The type of customer gateway. The only type AWS
supports at this time is &quot;ipsec.1&quot;.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="certificatearn_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#certificatearn_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Certificate<wbr>Arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the customer gateway certificate.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="devicename_csharp">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A name for the customer gateway device.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="ipaddress_csharp">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The IPv4 address for the customer gateway device's outside interface.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="tags_csharp">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Dictionary&lt;string, string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Tags to apply to the gateway. If configured with a provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.</p>
</dd></dl>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_tags_csharp">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Dictionary&lt;string, string&gt;</span>
    </dt>

</dd><dt class="property-optional property-deprecated"
            title="Optional, Deprecated">

            title="Optional">

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import Customer Gateways using the `id`. For example:

```sh
 $ pulumi import aws:ec2/customerGateway:CustomerGateway main cgw-b4dc3961
```
